for Website security assessment and report

bio:
I have worked in various positions in IT Audit for 10+ years and have been working as a freelance penetration tester for the last 6 years, serving international clients through a number of freelancer platforms.

Most of my pentest projects are web applications, but I also do mobile apps and network tests. 

The output of my work is a professionally written penetration test report, backed with evidences such as request-response pairs, screenshots and PoC codes.

Since my background is on bank auditing, the unique experience I bring to penetration tests is the testing of financial applications, such as internet banking and mobile banking systems.

My projects have two milestones. The first one is the delivery of the report. Second one is the verification of your fixes for the reported issues. The payment I prefer is 80% for report delivery and 20% for verification.

Upon request, we can have a closing meeting to go over the findings in the report, to support you or your developers, so that they understand the risks thoroughly.

abstrac: Bringing your vision to life with high-quality content that achieves measurable business goals.
bio: Having explored a variety of vocations, including clinical phlebotomy, marketing and communications, software engineering, and creative design, I've truly taken it upon myself to experience and understand firsthand the problems and questions in each domain. My common thread of interest throughout each experience was writing: whether that was technical documentation, sales copy, press releases, reports, research, or just writing about my experiences in my free time. Eventually, I began to discover that I could use my experience to help individuals and organizations convey their own message or brand, and decided to dedicate my time full time to providing writing services.

Located on the West Coast of the United States, you'll often find me online during our business hours (9 - 5 PST/PDT depending on time of year). However, I love my work and might be online earlier or later, depending on my clients' needs and current workload. You're welcome to message me on Guru for now for inquiries!

abstrac: A passionate artist and designer. Working hard doing what I love.
bio:
My life is my art and always has been. I have been honing my craft since I was a child and when I had the good fortune to attend one of the best Universities in the UK for 3D cg art and design(Bournemouth) I had the pleasure of being able to add animation to my repertoire. Since graduating I have been a freelance artists and designer working on a huge range of projects as well as running my own wedding and event stationery business. Through out my career I have always pushed myself, learning new skills and endeavoring to stay at the for front of modern technology and communication. 
   This inevitably brought me into learning about social media and all the various facets of how this rapidly moving multi platform beast can be used to enhance business practices. This culminated in taking up a position with Hilton Hotels where I managed the social media strategies for 13 hotel in the UK. My role required that I run ad campaign, create dynamic content, liase with dozens of different team and understand the various audiences that we needed to engage with.
   My work is never dull, much like myself and I will not rest until my clients are happy it is not just a matter of professionalism for me its personal.

I maintain working hours from 8 am (GMT) to 7 pm (GMT) depending on my work load. I manage payment per project with small project being paid on approval of final artwork and large project sometimes requiring a deposit once the direction and initial design work has been approved. I prefer to start communication with a conversation via either Skype, WhatsApp or Facebook followed generally by email communication as the project progresses. I like to make sure that my clients feel welcome to call me whenever the need to discuss the project as it progresses.
